page.title: 05Breeding Methods
page.content: {The Hampshire Cattle Breeders}store semen from bulls in straws. These are put into liquid nitrogen until they can be used. They have portable containers for the straws and can take these not only around Britain but also abroad to other farms. If it is found that a certain bull's semen produces a calf that has very good milk then the semen can be sent to any farmer in the world whose cows are not producing very good milk, he will inject the semen into his cows and their calves will produce better milk. The breeders send their own men to farms within their area where they will inseminate the cows for the farmer. If the cows produce bulls then the breeders have them, if the cows produce cows, then the farmer keeps them. This is known as { {"Contract Breeding."
